result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Paid $455.00 bill to Attorney Limbeck

and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees (signed 10/10/15)
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the attached attorney's statement of fees and expenses are approved in the amount of $455. Further, that the County of Sheboygan shall pay the attorney's fees and expenses in the amount of $455 to Atty George Limbeck 
IT IS ALSO HEREBY ORDERED that the Defendant, Thomas G Weedman, reimburse Sheboygan County in the amount of $455. Further, that the Defendant shall complete such reimbursement at the rate previously ordered by the Court. Should the Defendant fail to reimburse Sheboygan County for the amount owed, Sheboygan County may proceed with a civil judgment against the Defendant in order to collect on the funds
